questions.question: What is your Program End Date and where can you find it?
questions.answer: Your Program End is the date when you complete your program requirements (usually the date of your last class or completion of your last assignment or exam).

additional_info.location: Typically reflected on the first page of your I-20 Form
exceptions: Some students may complete their program earlier
Some students may require a program extension to complete their program later than the date listed

questions.question: What is a Grace Period and why is it important?
questions.answer: After you complete your program, you have 60 days to consider your options for staying in the U.S. also known as your 60 Day Grace Period.

travel.international: Cannot re-enter in F-1 status if you leave the U.S.

questions.question: When is the OPT application window?
questions.answer: A student's 5-month application period starts from 90 days before their program completion and ends 60 days after their program completion date in which USCIS must receive your OPT application.
questions.processing_time: Typically takes 3-4 months for USCIS to process an OPT application
questions.recommendation: Apply early due to processing time

questions.question: When should you submit your OPT application after receiving your OPT I-20 Form?
questions.answer: Your OPT I-20 Form is valid for 30 days from the date the ISSS office recommended you for OPT.

important_notes.deadline: The OPT application must be submitted to USCIS within 30 days of this date
important_notes.consequences: Applications submitted with an OPT I-20 Form 30 days after initial issuance will result in an application denial
important_notes.solution: If exceeding 30 days, submit another OPT request via MyISSS portal to receive a new OPT I-20 Form

questions.question: When can you start working on OPT?
questions.answer: A student who finishes all program requirements can choose an OPT start date from one day after their program completion to 60 days after that date.
important_requirements: Cannot start working before the OPT start date listed on the EAD card
Must physically have possession of your EAD card to start working
questions.processing_recommendation: Please try to give USCIS 90 days of processing before your requested OPT start date

questions.question: When does your work authorization end on OPT?
questions.answer: The OPT end date will be 12 months after the student's chosen OPT start date.

limitations.post_completion: The latest end date for Post-Completion OPT will never be beyond 14-months after program completion

pre_completion_impact.part_time: Students who use part-time Pre-Completion OPT deduct from Post-Completion OPT days at half the rate
pre_completion_impact.full_time: Students who use full-time Pre-Completion OPT deduct at the full rate

questions.question: Can students remain in the U.S. after finishing their period of OPT?
questions.answer: Students who complete their OPT period have a 60 Day Grace Period after their OPT has ended.

grace_period_details.restrictions: Cannot work during this grace period
grace_period_details.early_termination: If OPT ends early, no 60 Day Grace Period is afforded and should depart the U.S. soon after

questions.question: Do you qualify for the 2-year STEM OPT Extension?
questions.answer: Students who are on a period of approved Post-Completion OPT and have a STEM-qualifying degree can apply for the 24-month STEM OPT extension.

questions.question: When should students apply for the STEM OPT Extension?
questions.answer: Students should apply 90 days before their Post-Completion OPT expires.

important_notes.deadline: Once the Post-Completion OPT expires, students are no longer eligible to apply
